value.title: Lindsey Burke: Coronavirus school closings should prompt states to pay parents to educate kids in other ways
value.excerpt: States should provide emergency educations savings accounts to families for the remainder of the academic year. States should deposit into these parent-controlled accounts 90 percent of what the states would have spent on their children in the public school system from the time public classrooms were shut through the end of the school year.

value.title: Central Florida public schools start online lessons in face of coronavirus shutdowns
value.excerpt: Central Florida’s public schools on Monday begin a mammoth, and unprecedented, experiment trying to educate thousands of students who can no longer come to campus. Because of the coronavirus pandemic, the state has closed all of Florida’s public schools until at least April 15 but required that “distance learning” start by Monday.
